metadata.dc:author: Ruggeri, G
Zumaeta Luna, L
Paico Vílchez, E
Luca Ceccarelli, P
Lima, M
Domini, R
Grandi, M
metadata.dc:description: Eleven boys with Morris syndrome underwent feminizing genitoplasty utilizing a segment of the sigmoid colon for neovaginal reconstruction. Bilateral orchiectomy was performed for cosmetic reasons and to prevent neoplasms. Patient follow-up ranging from 6 months to 13 years have demonstrated good results were obtained. No intra- or postoperative complications were observed. Patient psycho-social-sexual identification and satisfaction were achieved.
metadata.dc:title: Cambio de sexo en niños con síndrome de Morris.
[Sex change in children with Morris syndrome].
